page.title: 20High Lorton 1752/1985
page.content: On one of his three visits to the area,in{1752,John Wesley}wrote in his diary:'..Lorton,a little village lying in a fruitful valley, surrounded by high mountains,the sides of which are covered with grass and woods,and the bottom watered by two small rivers.' The hills,streams,grass and trees are still here,as are the buildings of that time.Roads follow the same lines. Some village craftsmen have gone:the smith,millers and joiners,but the main industry,{sheep-farming,}still domin- ates the valley and fells. This record has been compiled in {July 1985}by the 10 upper-junior children of{Lorton Primary School}: Vicky Albon,Frederick Boardman,Robert Hannah,Timothy Newton,Lucy Nixon, Esther Rushton, Kevin Shield,Martin Teasdale,Karl Tyson and Stephen Wills, plus their teacher,Mr.D.Morriss.
